event.title: founded Dingle as a visita of Pototan in 1593

data.event: Francisco Manuel Blanco, first founded Dingle as a visita of Pototan in 1593.
In 1629 however, it was annexed to Dumangas, Iloilo and to Due√±as, Iloilo in 1641 (until 1825).

event.title: August 16, 1850, by order of Governor General of the Philippines Antonio de Urbiztondo, Dingle again became

data.event: On August 16, 1850, by order of Governor General of the Philippines Antonio de Urbiztondo, Dingle again became independent and was officially named the town of Dingle.
Fernando Llorente ordered the construction of the Dingle Catholic Church which was completed in 1886.
Now known as the "Cry of Lincud", the revolt occurred in Barrio Lincud on October 28, 1898.

event.title: occurred in Barrio Lincud on October 28, 1898

data.event: Now known as the "Cry of Lincud", the revolt occurred in Barrio Lincud on October 28, 1898.
Today the event is commemorated as a special non-working holiday.
Today, his statue stands inside the Philippine Army's Camp General Adriano Hernandez in Dingle, which is named in his honor.
